description: Designed with the whole life carbon footprint of the development in mind, this 5,000 sqm office building explores the principles of reduce, reuse and recycle using low carbon, low impact materials in both its structure and fit out.

factsheet.heading: Design Principles
paragraphs: Located on the Regent’s Canal in Hackney, 6 Orsman Road brings 5,000 sqm of flexible workspace over 6 storeys to the heart of Haggerston. Designed with the whole life carbon footprint of the development in mind, the building explores the principles of reduce, reuse and recycle using low carbon/low impact materials in both its structure and fit out.

factsheet.heading: Designed for the Future
paragraphs: Built using an innovative hybrid structure which combines cross laminated timber (CLT) and steel to achieve maximum internal area, the building is designed so its elements can ultimately be demounted, repurposed or recycled at the end of its useful life. The structure is bolted together and applied elements – i.e. SIP panels, cladding, timber decking, steel balustrades - can all be easily disassembled.

The use of a prefabricated CLT-steel frame creates large column free spaces that facilitate flexible and adaptive configuration of internal layouts and MEP to suit tenant demands. A demountable partition system has been used throughout, meaning that office space can be reconfigured overnight as needs change. The building can adapt and evolve as required, providing individuals with a high level of ownership over their workspace and the ability to curate it to meet their needs.

factsheet.heading: Embodied Carbon
paragraphs: Greenhouse gas emissions caused by the construction of new buildings and infrastructure, known as ‘embodied carbon emissions’, are a significant driver of climate change. Embodied carbon emissions are caused by the extraction and production of building materials and any emissions caused during construction. They also include emissions from maintaining and replacing any elements throughout the whole life-cycle of a building and, also, the ‘end of life’ stage, such as demolition and disassembly. Embodied carbon emissions account for 40% of global carbon emissions related to buildings.

With embodied carbon of 582 KgCO2eq/m2 6 Orsman Road exceeds all current targets and is close to the RIBA Climate Challenge target set for 2030. This has been achieved through careful and conscious selection of all materials used throughout the building.

The building’s core and floor slabs are made of pre-cut CLT panels which has resulted in a significant reduction compared to a concrete build of the same design which would have had embodied carbon of 3,812 kgCO2eq/m2

factsheet.heading: Prioritising Passive Solutions
paragraphs: The building is stepped over six storeys preserving views down Orsman Road and creating large terraces which overlook the canal to the north and the city to the south. In order to maximise the benefits of this north-south site, a fully glazed curtain walling maximises internal daylight and views out to the canal to the north, while on the south façade deep-set, ribbon windows minimise solar gain. Full height windows and doors on both facades can be opened to allow for natural though ventilation. It is expected that the building can operate comfortably using natural ventilation for cooling.

factsheet.heading: Health & Wellbeing
paragraphs: Everything at 6 Orsman Road, from the exposed timber to the waterside setting, has been designed to make customers feel calm, focused and inspired. Specialist acousticians developed acoustic guidelines for the office to ensure that there were a range of spaces where productivity would not be impacted by bustle and noise; the timber surfaces and panels within the building absorb sound and so improve comfort. Other areas within the building have been created for noisier and more collaborative work, such as the lounge and the café.

Throughout 6 Orsman Road a range of all-natural materials have been used, including clay finishes and marmoleum tiles, which, when paired with natural daylight and air-purifying plants, come together to create a working environment that actively boosts productivity and improves wellbeing.

factsheet.heading: Green Infrastructure & Biodiversity
paragraphs: 6 Orsman Road is located in a prime position on the bank of the tranquil Regent’s Canal in Haggerston, between Shoreditch, Hoxton and Dalston. Conveniently located on Super Cycle Highway 1 with access to cycling routes across London.

The building is equipped with easily accessible and ample storage for 68 bicycles, located in a prominent location at the entrance to the building, reinforcing the message that cycling should be the primary means of commute into the building.

The private and shared rooftop terraces with panoramic views over London have been specifically designed to allow multiple working styles through the use of outdoor shading, providing a range of spaces to suit everyone’s needs. Designed with the environment in mind the planting is biodiverse, and features edible plants and fruit trees and insect boxes, to attract wildlife to this urban space.
